intro: Psychotria rzedowskiana, commonly known as the Rzedowskiana Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the cloud forests of Mexico and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
